comments:
I had terminated a target eclipse session where I was playing with cancelling 
debug launch configurations.  There were javaw.exe processes hanging around.  I 
killed the process in the task manager:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.fireEvents
(EventDispatcher.java:227)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.dispatch
(EventDispatcher.java:126)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.run
(EventDispatcher.java:155)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:484)

Looks like the debug plug-in was shutdown, but the event dispatcher was still 
going.

This is possible.  #dispatch has various checks for isShutdown but can get to 
fireEvents and the "world" has shutdown behind it. Added a null check in 
fireEvents.
